column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Oyarzun Marchesi (Spain) (spoke in Spanish):\r
#Text=If my voice sounds shaky, it is because I find it very\r
#Text=difficult to speak in this Chamber after Nadia.
#Text=The walk\r
#Text=from my office to the Chamber today was a peaceful\r
#Text=one.
#Text=I am lucky not to live in a conflict situation.
#Text=I am\r
#Text=lucky not to know first-hand what human trafficking is.
#Text=I am lucky not to know what sexual violence in conflict\r
#Text=1s.
#Text=The closest I have ever been to such situations was\r
#Text=in March when the Secretary-General inaugurated the\r
#Text=Permanent Memorial to Honour the Victims of Slavery\r
#Text=and the Transatlantic Slave Trade at the entrance of\r
#Text=United Nations Headquarters.
#Text=And I remember that at\r
#Text=that event he said clearly that the monument should lead\r
#Text=us not to forget the past but should above all make us\r
#Text=look to the future - and to take a look at the present\r
#Text=and at human trafficking, which is nothing less than the\r
#Text=modern form of slavery.
#Text=I therefore would begin by urging all representatives\r
#Text=and Members of the Organization to look at the Memorial\r
#Text=every time we enter United Nations Headquarters, and\r
#Text=to think of people such as Nadia who have not had the\r
#Text=life the rest of us have had and use all the tools we have\r
#Text=within our reach to fight with greater steadfastness\r
#Text=against human trafficking and sexual violence in\r
#Text=conflict.
#Text=I believe the presidential statement adopted today\r
#Text=(S/PRST/2015/25) is a good step in the right direction\r
#Text=but it is certainly not enough.
#Text=And I congratulate the\r
#Text=Permanent Representative of the United States for\r
#Text=having awakened our consciences this afternoon to\r
#Text=the phenomenon of trafficking, which is something\r
#Text=of which we should really be ashamed.
#Text=It is probably\r
#Text=one of the most deplorable phenomena currently being\r
#Text=experienced by humankind.
#Text=I would like to share two preliminary observations\r
#Text=with the Council, before attempting to propose some\r
#Text=additional measures to fight effectively against human\r
#Text=trafficking.
#Text=My first observation is that sexual violence\r
#Text=strategically exercised by Daesh and other terrorist\r
#Text=groups can considerably increase the likelihood that\r
#Text=women and girls will be trafficked.
#Text=I would like to\r
#Text=reiterate the words of the President of the Spanish\r
#Text=Government, who said a few weeks ago that it is more\r
#Text=dangerous to be a woman in armed conflicts than to be\r
#Text=a soldier.
#Text=That is a very sobering remark.
#Text=My second observation is that it is unacceptable for\r
#Text=trafficking in women and children to be a part of the\r
#Text=political economy, or worse, the financial economy, of\r
#Text=terrorist groups.
#Text=We must fight against this phenomenon\r
#Text=in an absolute and across-the-board manner.
#Text=Further, I would refer to two errors that we\r
#Text=simply should not make.
#Text=The first is believing that the\r
#Text=phenomenon is limited only to Daesh; it is not limited\r
#Text=to Daesh, as the Deputy Secretary-General also said.
#Text=Let us keep in mind the 276 girls kidnapped from the\r
#Text=secondary school in Chibok.
#Text=I think it is important\r
#Text=not to lose sight of that fact.
#Text=The second is that human\r
#Text=trafficking is not a phenomenon exclusively linked to\r
#Text=terrorism.
#Text=Rather, it is a phenomenon that is also linked\r
#Text=to the major conflicts we are experiencing today and\r
#Text=the huge number of refugees in the world.
#Text=Refugees\r
#Text=and displaced persons give rise to making trafficking a\r
#Text=phenomenon that is easier to practice.
#Text=Turning now to the United Nations, I believe that,\r
#Text=although the existing legal architecture was inadequate\r
#Text=to help Nadia, and I completely understand that it\r
#Text=was, we need to begin by implementing it much more\r
#Text=effectively, in particular the Palermo Protocol and\r
#Text=other instruments.
#Text=I can say with pride that my country,\r
#Text=Spain, recently approved a comprehensive plan of\r
#Text=action to fight trafficking in women and children for\r
#Text=the years 2015-2018, in order to ensure that there is no\r
#Text=recurrence of cases such as Nadia's.
#Text=Secondly, in strengthening the role of United\r
#Text=Nations and the Security Council in fighing human\r
#Text=trafficking, we must think about incorporating in the\r
#Text=mandates of sanctions committees such serious and\r
#Text=humbling subjects for humankind as the trafficking in\r
#Text=persons.
#Text=I would conclude by discussing the victims.
#Text=Council members know that my country has been a\r
#Text=standard-bearing country for defending the victims\r
#Text=of terrorism.
#Text=We organized an Arria Formula meeting\r
#Text=of the Security Council at which, for the first time,\r
#Text=victims of terrorism were able to express themselves.
#Text=Today Ambassador Power made it possible for Nadia, a\r
#Text=victim of trafficking, to bravely take the floor and tell\r
#Text=her truth in the Security Council.
#Text=Finally, ifbeing a victim of terrorism is serious, one\r
#Text=can imagine how much more serious it would be to be\r
#Text=a victim of terrorism and trafficking at the same time.
#Text=Accordingly, I would address Nadia personally and\r
#Text=assure her that the delegation of Spain will continue to\r
#Text=fight to keep experiences like hers from ever recurring.
#Text=I hope that within a few years we will no longer need\r
#Text=United Nations funds to help people whose lives have\r
#Text=been as difficult as hers has been.
